meanings.definition: To dance energetically to pop music.
meanings.sent1: She was boogieing on the dance floor all night long.
meanings.sent2: Everyone at the party was boogieing to the catchy tunes.
meanings.sent3: The cat started boogieing when the music came on, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His heart was boogieing with excitement as he awaited the results.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the room as they were boogieing joyfully.

meanings.definition: The act of dancing energetically to pop music.
meanings.sent1: Her boogieing was so infectious that soon everyone joined in.
meanings.sent2: The crowd erupted into cheers at the sight of her enthusiastic boogieing.
meanings.sent3: The boogieing competition at the school talent show was a hit with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were alive with the sound of music and boogieing.
meanings.sent5: His passion for boogieing was evident in every move he made on the dance floor.
